topics.body:
I sometimes wondered the origins of the names of some websites.

Did a pirate tumble down a flight of stairs and made Tumblr?
Did Goofy invent Yahoo?
Did a factory worker spelled 'goggle' wrong?
Did a U-tube invent Youtube?
Did Mark Zuckerberg love selfies and printed them in a book?

topics.body:
I like the idea of power without perception.

It's a concept you see in fiction a lot. Often what separates a hero from a villain (or a hero turned villain like Saruman) is that the villainous one lacks spiritual understanding and instead is only focused on the material world. Usually this manifests as believing in power over all. Due to them being divorced from moral ideals this becomes power for its own sake, which later still devolves into Might Makes Right.
topics.author: 4fe16df67f123b13e400003f

topics.body:
"@Whatevs":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53981bcf6368720b37750300#post_53981bcf6368720b37750300
Power, in and of itself, is not a bad thing. It is a tool like most everything in this world. It's what you Do with that power that shapes who you are. I've always been a big fan of the chivalrous code. "Might FOR right."
topics.author: 4fde4618945b700aa0002fff
